intro: Lagochilus lasiocalyx, commonly known as the woolly bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its medicinal and ornamental species. It typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
